chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer
Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
The defendant Landon D. Roelfs was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain absolute sobriety. May not possess or consume any intoxicants. May not possess or consume any controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician presently treating the defendant.
Defendant shall undergo AODA assessment and all treatment and counseling as agent deems appropriate.
Upon successful completion of probation, count may be expunged under Wis Stat 973.015.
Costs, surcharges & supervision fees to be paid during the term of probation as arranged by the agent.
Defendant shall cooperate with, participate in, and successfully complete evaluations, treatment and counseling deemed appropriate by Agent.

supervisions.notes: same AODA, PROHIBITIONS and OTHER conditions as Count 1

records.addlTxt:
9:00 AM Defendant Landon D. Roelfs in court.  Attorney Robert S. Duxstad in court for Landon D. Roelfs.  Attorney Craig Nolen in court for State of Wisconsin. State complied with Victim Witness Notification. Deputy Scott Maresch Sworn on oath & testifies under direct and cross. Witness identifies the defendant. Deputy Maresch excused from the witness stand. State moves for bind over. Court finds probable cause.  Defendant bound over for trial. Information filed. Court advises defendant of charges & penalties. Attorney Nolen provided paper copy to Defense. Defendant waives reading of information.  Defendant stands mute, Court enters not guilty plea on defendants behalf. Matter set over. .
Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
